poem:
Title: "A Dance of Lions"

The Channels,
red and raging,
wage open warfare -
a bitter taste on every tongue.

Awaiting the verdict,
edges of our seats,
we are the audience 
to this media battleground.

Each word, an arrow,
each broadcast, a bold defiance,
this is not a play of innocents,
but a furious dance of lions.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Bruce Lehrmann case sends Seven, Nine and Ten into internecine TV warfare | Weekly Beast It’s been open warfare in the media as the nation awaits a decision in the Bruce Lehrmann v Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson defamation case on Monday. And we don’t mean the recent Ten v Seven drama in the federal court in which the network that aired The Project interview with Brittany Higgins introduced new evidence in their defence case". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
